headline: Jen's Heavenly Egg Salad
description: The tang from the Dijon, freshness from the lemon, and liveliness when paired with watercress makes this recipe a MUST! This recipe tastes best when paired with wheat bread, watercress and avocado!! But I can eat it by itself
name: Jen's Heavenly Egg Salad

recipeInstructions.text: Place egg in a saucepan and cover with cold water. Bring water to a boil and immediately remove from heat. Cover and let eggs stand in hot water for 10 to 12 minutes. Remove from hot water, cool and peel. For faster cooling, place the eggs in an ice bath before peeling.

In a medium bowl, stir together the mayonnaise, Dijon mustard, yellow mustard, lemon juice and green onions. Chop the eggs into big chunks and mix gently with the dressing. Season with salt and pepper.

review.reviewBody: I give it 4 stars because the taste is fabulous! I like to make recipes exactly as written the first time. I thought the juice of half a lemon was a bit much, and it was. It turned out very runny and I found it impossible to make into a sandwich. Next time I will try half a tablespoon of lemon juice.
We love finding new recipes and trying out different ways of making regular recipes, this recipe turned out great thank you.
Very tasty. The lemon juice is a great idea!
This was the best egg salad I've had in a long time. I didn't have all the ingredients but the lemon juice is what I have been missing, made it taste great!
Simple and delicious! I didn't have green onions on hand so I substituted some dried chives!
great flavor and easy to make
I chose this because it looked quick and easy. It was! I loved the outcome, I have saved it to make again.
Delicious as a side dish or a sandwich.
Eggcelent!

I did make a change. I did not add dijon simply because i did not have any and I added onion only when i made my sandwich because my husband does not like onion.
Also when I made my sandwich, I put Miracle whip on the bread for that little tang I enjoy.
Flavor was good, but I agree with other reviews. Donâ€™t use all of the lemon juice from half lemon. Very tart and soupy result. I had to eat my sandwich with a fork it was too messy to pick up.
It's good! Just came out a little watery I put to much mayo in there
Nice take on my favorite! Only used a Tablespoon of lemon juice and it was perfect! Thank you!!!
Easy and good. I added a half-spear of sour dill pickle as well as some dry dill.
Add ANY amount of mustard of ANY kind to anything - and thats ALL you're gonna taste.
Add paprika and pickle relish. As is comes out salty (like I like it) but needs pepper. Will try it with more mustard and hot sauce.

Delicious, and the lemon juice gives adds a nice freshness. I wanted to make this but just didn't have the green onions on hand. I added celery and dill, but I'm sure it will be that much better when I do have the green onions! Thanks for the good recipe.
I found the lemon juice to be too much...so I reduced the amount by 1/2 and it was much better! This is really delicious!
Excellent. The lemon juice really sets it off!
A favorite in my house.
I change nothing. Perfect as is
This was fabulous. I didn't know egg salad could be so elegant.

This was beautiful. I was most nervous about the boiling time- I usually let my eggs spend 10 minutes or so under rapidly boiling water to make my hard-boiled eggs, so I was a bit unsure about the instructions here. This technique produces a very soft, bright yellow yolk that i'm not used to- it felt undercooked to me. But lo and behold, by the time everything got chopped up and combined, the salad tasted perfect.

I like to add a healthy pinch of paprika and a tiny amount of cayenne, but the salad is also great as is.
Will make again
We loved it! I added celery, as was recommendation from others. I think it will taste better after it stands in the refrigerator for the night. We ate it right after making it and it was a bit warm.

I mostly followed the recipe- I just added a favorite spice of mine, toasted onion from Penzey's- my sample taste of this was great. I didn't have the green onion, so I used celery as others mentioned for crunch.

This was a big hit with our family. I never thought to mix different mustards. I took the advice of a few other reviews and added less lemon as I wasn't completely sold on using it in the recipe. Less is always best since you can add more. Liked this so much I'm making it again tonight. Nothing fancy but very good on taste.
I Like
This is amazing and reminds me so much of my Grandmother's egg salad! I did add some celery for more texture.

This is clearly the Best egg salad I have ever made . I do one change and add two teaspoons of sweet relish and a little paprika . It gives it nice kick . You could also use hot relish depending on you taste both work great . Thanks for the recipe Jen
Simply Delicious Egg Salad! Five Star and a Plus! This recipe will make a great Egg Salad Sandwich! Yummy!
I did enjoy the egg salad :) My advise is to have it as a sandwich with lettuce, tomato and hot peppers!

I loved this egg salad and it was such a hit! I didn't have any mayo so followed some other review advice and replaced with the same amount of plain hummus,, perfection!!! No one even noticed it was missing the mayo. It was the first item to go at my brunch party. I followed the instructions to cook for 12 servings but it was way too little. I would definitely recommend you increase the amount.
This was just what i was looking for. Simple and I had everything on hand. The lemon added a touch of brightness. I did add a little diced celery for a bit more crunch, but the flavor was wonderful!

Don't add too much lemon juice! Start with no more than 1T, then taste and add more only if you want. 
I used finely chopped red onion because we didn't have green onions. Served on lightly toasted whole wheat bread with a tomato slice and mixed greens.
The lemon juice adds a little tang, and the green onions add some additional flavor. Nice recipe.
I love the simplicity of this recipe, yet it boasts of flavor. I even added about a 1/2 teaspoon smoked paprika, and wow. So, so good!

Seriously delicious. Don't skip the lemon juice because it really makes the salad. I wasn't a fan of egg salad based on previous experience but I can't wait to dig into this later. I didn't have dijon mustard so I gave regular. Thanks for the recipe.

I decided to make this one afternoon and followed the recipe exactly, except I used 8 eggs. It is a great egg salad, but I thought it was a little TOO runny. It did not want to hold together and kept falling off the bread. Fabulous flavor.
THIS IS A PRETTY GOOD RECIPE....AS A RULE, I DON'T LIKE EGG SALAD, BUT FOUND MYSELF WITH SOME HB EGGS AND DIDN'T WANT TO WASTE THEM. I ADDED 1/2 TSP OF DILL AND A PINCH OF CAYENNE.
Really great tasting! My only complaint was that I think the lemon made this a bit watery - am going to leave it out next time. I also added lots of fresh dill! Loved it

Didn't change a thing about this recipe, and got rave reviews! It was nice and creamy. Sometimes egg salad can be very dry, but this was just right! Also, I wasn't sure if I should just chop the whites, and mix the yolks with the wet ingredients (kind of how you make deviled egg filling), but was advised to chop ALL of the egg together. Glad I did, the egg salad really came out just right.
I added just a bit of sweet pickle relish

I had a lot of eggs that I wanted to use up, so I was planning to double the recipe. However, after doubling the dressing, I still didn't have enough for 12 eggs, so I ended up tripling the dressing to get enough for 12 eggs. I didn't have a lemon, so I used 1 tsp lemon juice, and thought that gave it just enough zing. I also added 1 chopped celery stalk to add some crunch. Overall it has good flavor, and I'll be making this again.
I didn't put all 6 eggs as we like it a bit saucy. My husband adds tuna to it. He loves this recipe. We'll be making this a lot for his lunches. Great recipe.
Absolutely great had my husband in raptures over the flavour - must say I did use hot english mustard as well as dijon - just great will use again

This egg salad is amazing!! I usually buy egg salad from the supermarket, but I wasn't going to go all the way to the store just for egg salad. I had most of the ingredients in my kitchen, so I thought I'd try this one out. I've never seen an egg salad recipe with lemon and I didn't have one in my pantry, so I didn't use it. I added a few splashes of Tapatio for some kick and a teaspoon of pickle juice for flavor. I love it!!!!!!! My only regret is that I don't have enough eggs to make more :(
Very good egg salad recipe!! Husband put it together and it turned out perfect!! Thanks for a great recipe will use it from now on!
Delicious! The best egg salad I have ever made!
Excellent recipe - I really like the hint of lemon in this. Used my very favorite dijon mustard from Trader Joe's and used celery salt when seasoning.

I made this recipe yesterday but i made some modifications. I nixed the lemon juice (it was just to far out there for me lol) I added celery & green peppers. This was my first time making egg salad and i was shocked with how good it tasted and almost tasted as good as the egg salad my mom use to make. Great recipe Thank you!!!

I just want to say, I had a taste for egg and olive salad so I used this recipe and added chopped green olives (the kind that are stuffed with pimentos). I also only had about a teaspoon of lemon, used Duke's light mayo, and left out the green onions ( I didn't have any on hand)- OH MY GOD! I could eat this everyday for the rest of my life. I put it on some toasted challah bread. Wonderful.
Really like this version. It's one of my favorites.
Easy and good recipe

I love egg salad, yet I don't eat it much at all. I doubled the recipe and I thought it was a bit on the sour side for me. I think if you don't like it sour, you might be able to substitute Miracle Whip for the mayonaise, or add some sweet relish or something. Great recipe otherwise.
My husband loved this! So fresh - and I just used a splash of lemon juice. Delish!

This is a very good recipe, been making a similar egg salad for years and it has always tasted great. This one tastes just as good, but has a fresher taste. My version I use 1/2 teaspoon Capers chopped in the food processor (strong flavor, so a little goes a long way), instead of onions, and since not always I have lemons or limes in my pantry I substitute with approx. 1-1/2 teaspoons of Cider Vinegar. If you don't have Dijon on hand, just use 1 teaspoon of Yellow Mustard. Haven't tried it in a sandwich with avocado, but will try soon.
Very solid recipe imo. Girl and I liked it quite a bit. Only thing I did different, was add less lemon juice than called for, and added about a tsp of smoked paprika.

I raise chickens so I'm always looking for good egg recipes and this was a very good one for egg salad. Unlike some others, I thought the amount of lemon was perfect. But, being a huge sushi fan, I replaced the Dijon mustard with wasabi (Japanese horseradish paste). It added a nice kick and I served it on wheat bread with spinach leaves. Delicious!

Excellent I did up it to 12 servings to feed a crowd I didnt change anything and it was perfect. I served it on toast with leaf lettuce, tomato, avacado and stackers dill pickles. My mother in law asked for the recipe and my houseguest who swore he didnt eat egg salad had a couple sandwiches. I think it would be good with a little rooster sauce too. 5 stars.
Great Egg Salad!

Super egg salad. I left out the green onions (although I'd love them!) for my kids. We ate it on warm French bread with lettuce, avocado and tomato. Side of tomato basil soup. Great and quick dinner. I just eye balled the lemon juice until the consistency was about right.

This was really good. I went easy on the lemon juice, just added it slowly. Gave it a bit of brightness but I didn't taste the lemon. Added some diced celery, red onion and some dill. Great recipe thanks!

I used all regular yellow mustard because I am not a big fan of dijon mustard. I loved the addition of using lemon juice in this. It added such a nice, bright flavor! This recipe can easily be customized to suite anyone's taste. I made it according to the recipe, tasted it then decided to add black pepper, dill weed, celery seed and a little bit of dill relish. This is SO yummy and I will make it many times in the future since DH is such an egg salad fan. Thank you for sharing!
I make this quite often. Love this recipe....so easy!

We loved this fresh tasting egg salad! I wanted to do a bigger batch so I doubled everything except the lemon juice, kept that at half a lemon. I did add a stalk of celery finely diced for a little crunch, perfect, I like how the lemon makes it a little 'spritzy'. For those who don't enjoy lemon, choose another recipe!

Perfect recipe for classic egg salad sandwiches. What I did add was a bit of jalapeno and substituted some spicy honey mustard for the Dijon mustard to give the traditional recipe a little kick. I left out the lemon since I didn't have one around, but it still tasted great!
I used a quarter of a lemon - juice. and 8 eggs. I did add Cayenne pepper for a kick AMAZING EGG SALAD. PEOPLE DO NOT ADD HALF A LEMON JUICE THAT WILL KILL IT.
Nice recipe!! By the way if you guys are looking for more recipes check out this site too FindGreatRecipes.Net They have lots of recipes on there that aren't on this site.
Simple and yummy... what more could you ask for? Kids ate it up and asked me to make it again.
My first eggs salad and it was delicious. I let it cool and harden up in the fridge for 10 minutes after making it. Really good tho!
This is a really good egg salad. I used all egg whites so I boiled 8 eggs. I did not care for the watercress with the egg salad, but the other proportions were fantastic!
pretty much perfect. thanks jen!
Nice and tangy! We have chickens, and thus a lot of eggs, so I'm always looking for new ways to make egg salad.

This is the egg salad recipe I have been searching for. So easy yet so delicious! I did make a few substitutions such as Zatarain's creole mustard for the dijon and yellow mustards and light mayo instead of regular. I also added a few tbsp of diced celery and some dried dill, as suggested by another reviewer. The lemon juice was about 1.5 to 2 tsp. Perfect. It will be gobbbled up quickly.
This is a great egg salad. I needed to add a few more eggs (I hate a runny egg salad), and a touch more mustard. I also stirred in a tiny bit of relish.

I am not an egg salad eatter, however my husband simply cannot get enough of this stuff! I love egg salad because it's easy to make and you can make a huge batch early in the week and eat it for breakfast on a bagel, on crackers for a snack, or on bread for a sandwich. This is my new go-to egg salad recipe---HE LOVED IT! Only thing is next time I may not use as much Mayo, but that's just for his taste buds. Thanks for the great recipe!
I usually don't like egg salad but this was awesome! The lemon taste is pretty strong but I like that!..I used red onion instead of green..very tasty!

UPDATE: I have a lot of egg salad recipes that I have saved in my inbox, but none fo them seemed to have peaked my interest. This is the one I came back to and that I'm craving for right now! This the only egg salad that I will make from now on. Definitely the best egg salad recipe on this site. OLD REVIEW: The lemon gives a nice refreshing zest to the egg salad, but like many others, I didn't add all the lemon called for in the recipe. I cut about a 1/4 of a lemon which gave me 1-2 tsp of juice. I found it to be plenty for my taste and the dressing wasn't so runny. I used 6 small eggs and it was the right ratio to the dressing. If you decide use the juice of half a lemon, then I recommend that you use large or extra-large eggs for an nice balance. One thing to note that is not mentioned in the recipe, is to run the boiled eggs under cold water several times and/or leaving them in a cold bath for a few minutes, to make it easier to peel (without taking any of the white egg attached to the shell). This is a yummy recipe and I would definitely make it again. The recipe as written seems enough for 2 hungry people, but I would suggest doubling it for a family (only if using small eggs like I did). Thanks for sharing your recipe, Jen!

Awesome- thanks! I did not have dijon mustard handy, so I used honey mustard salad dressing and it turned out great. I also didn't have a lemon at home so I had to leave that out. I took other peoples suggestions and added peppers and celery.

I make this often. I usually double it (12 eggs) and use it for my breakfast for the workweek. I add celery and green relish if I have any on hand. I will add finely diced red bell pepper sometimes for extra veg and colour.

This is a nice change from the regular egg salad sandwich. The mustard added a nice tang, as did the lemon juice, but I only put a little lemon juice per my taste. I also had a little dill weed and celery that I chopped up and added along with the green onion. Sprinkled with a little paprika and served as sandwiches and with potato chips. I like this recipe much better than my own!
I love this egg salad! It's perfect!

A really great foundational recipe. The proportions are exactly on. I used the exact amounts called for in the recipe, and it came out perfect. I got about a 1/4 cup of lemon juice from my 1/2 lemon, and I was scared it would be too much, but it was perfect! It cuts the creaminess of the mayo, and you don't really taste the lemon, but it brightens everything up. I had to boil my eggs a little longer, but I live at high altitude, so maybe that has something to do with it. Would be amazing with green olives or capers. Great on crackers, toast, a piece of lettuce, and delicious stuffed in a fresh tomato! I added about 3/4 tsp of salt and a 1/4 tsp of pepper and it seemed right for what I needed it to be. Just a perfect springboarding recipe as the dressing is right on. Refrigerating for an hour or two really helps it come together and mellow out too. I would definitely recommend that. Delicious!

The flavors in this recipe are great-- I love the lightness the citrus adds to the salad. I'm not a huge fan of really creamy salads though, so I cut the mayo down to 3 T. Per others' suggestions, I cut down the lemon juice too (I actually used lime, but it turned out great!)- about 1-1/2 T. I added 1/4 cup finely diced green bell pepper, and 1 finely diced clove of garlic. If you throw the garlic in the lemon juice, it takes the bite out of the garlic, which is nice. I definitely want to try this again-- maybe I'll use the dressing on chicken, and add some curry and raisins.
I don't know what happened. I followed the directions to the letter, and the yolks refused to solidify with the rest of the egg. Fresh ones, too.

I don't think I've ever had egg salad before, so I don't know what it is supposed to taste like. But I'm now a convert -- this was delicious. I was cautious about adding the lemon juice after reading other reviews, but ended up using all the juice from half a lemon as called for in the recipe. I don't see what the problem is. I didn't have any green onions, but I added a little diced red pepper, which was very good. I don't think I would have liked this as much without the added crunch and flavor pop of the peppers. A little diced pickle would probably push this over the top for me. Yum.

I added sweet pickles and sweet paprika but this recipe was very good! I'm trying to make egg salad like a cafteria in Houston (Cleburne's) and I think if I just add capers, I might get there! Thanks for the recipe!

I just made this for the first time...having never made egg salad before. I didn't have Dijon mustard on hand, so I just substituted it for more yellow mustard, and I didn't have green onions or a lemon. Instead, I just about a teaspoon of bottled lemon juice. Even with having to make these substitutions, this egg salad was incredible! I will make it again and again. To make it a bit healthier, I used olive oil mayo rather than the regular stuff.
very good and very easy

I'm making for the second time now. It is very good and has received rave reviews from family. I just substituted chives for green onions because they are in my herb garden,and added chopped celery. Thanks!
My friends and I loved it. Next time I'm going to add chopped up celery for a little crunch.
This recipe was really, really good. It was quick and easy. The only thing I changed was I added two chopped baby dill pickles and two chopped celery ribs. Absolutely loved it.
Very delish! Perfect flavor combination.

Like other reviewers I did far less lemon juice - i added just a splash. I added celery for crunch and a tablespoon of Miracle Whip for zip - along with the mayo, just less regular mayo. Pretty good recipie, wish I had some watercress on hand, sounds like a yummy addition.
Delicious w/ a little zip. I added fresh dill and chives from the garden to add a bit of flavor. I look forward to making many yummy sandwiches with this recipe.

One of the best egg salads I've ever had! Was skeptical about the lemon juice but it really does work. Ate it with a few leaves of baby arugula on thickly-sliced wheat bread. Wonderful! Looking forward to trying it with avocado. Thanks!

Having never had egg salad sandwiches before, I cannot compare this recipe to anything else, but can say that I enjoyed it. I added maybe 1/2 tsp more of the mustard, used pickle juice instead of lemon juice since that is what we had on hand, and I don't care for onions so I omitted them. I would definitely make this egg salad again though - again with a smidge more mustard and with the pickle juice. Thanks for sharing!
I followed the recipe exactly and it came out perfectly. It made a quick and delicious lunch.
